1.verse: Salutation -Chapter 1 -Address and Greeting. -Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy to the Church of Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: grace to you and peace.

2.verse: Evangelization Is the Work of the Spirit -A Model for All Believers. -We always give thanks to God for all of you and mention you in our prayers.

3.verse: We constantly remember before our God and Father your work of faith and your labor of love and your perseverance in hope in our Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: Brethren, beloved by God, we know that he has chosen you,

5.verse: because our gospel came to you not merely in words alone but also in power and in the Holy Spirit and with profound conviction. And you are fully aware what sort of people we proved to be when we were among you for your sake.

6.verse: And you in turn became imitators of us and of the Lord, for despite great suffering you received the word with joy in the Holy Spirit,

7.verse: so that you became a model for all the believers in Macedonia and Achaia.

8.verse: Not only has the word of the Lord rung forth from you in Macedonia and Achaia, but also your faith in God has become known everywhere. Therefore, we do not have the need to speak about it.

9.verse: For the people themselves report what kind of reception we had from you, and how you turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God

10.verse: and await his Son from heaven whom he raised from the dead—Jesus, who will deliver us from the wrath that is to come.

1.verse: Chapter 2 -Paul’s Loving Treatment of the Thessalonians. -You yourselves are well aware, brethren, that our visit to you has not been in vain.

2.verse: Although we had suffered and been shamefully mistreated at Philippi, as you surely recall, God gave us the courage to declare the gospel of God to you despite great opposition.

3.verse: The exhortation we impart does not spring from deceit or impure motives or trickery.

4.verse: God has judged us worthy to be entrusted with the gospel. Therefore, when we speak, our intention is not to please human beings but to please God who tests our hearts.

5.verse: As you are also aware, and as God is our witness, we have never resorted to flattering words or to your sense of greed.

6.verse: Neither did we seek praise from human beings, whether from you or from others.

7.verse: As apostles of Christ, we could have imposed our will on you, yet we were as gentle in our treatment of you as a mother nursing and caring for her own children.

8.verse: Our affection for you was so great that we were determined to share with you not only the gospel of God but also our very lives, because you had become so dear to us.

9.verse: You surely remember, brethren, our toil and drudgery as we worked night and day so that we would not be a burden to anyone while we proclaimed the gospel of God to you.

10.verse: You are witnesses, as is God, that our treatment of you who believed has been devout, upright, and blameless.

11.verse: As you are well aware, we treated each one of you as a father treats his children,

12.verse: urging and encouraging you and pleading with you to lead lives worthy of God who calls you into his kingdom and glory.

13.verse: The Word of God Is at Work. -We also unceasingly give thanks to God because, when we handed on the word of God to you, you accepted it not as a human word but as what it truly is, the word of God, which is at work in you who believe.

14.verse: Indeed, brethren, you have become imitators of the Churches of God that are in Judea in Christ Jesus. For you have suffered the same treatment from your own countrymen as they did from the Jews,

15.verse: who killed both the Lord Jesus and the Prophets and also persecuted us.They displease God and have become enemies of the entire human race

16.verse: by trying to prevent us from speaking to the Gentiles so that they may be saved. In this way, they constantly reach the full measure of their sins. The wrath of God has begun to overtake them at last.

17.verse: The Glory and Joy of the Apostles. -Brethren, when we were separated from you for a brief time—in body but not in heart—we had an intense longing to see you again face to face.

18.verse: Therefore, we were determined to come to visit you—I, Paul, on more than one occasion—but Satan thwarted us.

19.verse: For what is our hope or our joy or our crown of honor in the presence of our Lord Jesus upon his return? Is it not you yourselves?

20.verse: You truly are our glory and our joy.

1.verse: Chapter 3 -Standing Firm in the Lord. -Therefore, when we could not stand it any longer, we decided to remain alone in Athens.

2.verse: We sent Timothy, our brother and coworker for God in the gospel of Christ, to confirm and encourage you in your faith,

3.verse: so that no one might be troubled by these hardships.You yourselves realize that we were destined to endure such afflictions.

4.verse: In fact, when we were with you, we warned you beforehand that we could suffer persecution, and that is what has now come to pass, as you are well aware.

5.verse: For this reason, when I could bear it no longer, I sent to learn of your faith, lest the tempter might have put you to the test and all our labor might have been for naught.

6.verse: But Timothy has just now returned to us from you and brought us the joyful news of your faith and love. He tells us that you always speak fondly of us and long to see us just as much as we long to see you.

7.verse: For this reason, brethren, in the midst of our distress and hardship we have been reassured by your faith.

8.verse: For now we live inasmuch as you stand firm in the Lord.

9.verse: Plea for Growth in Holiness. -How can we possibly give thanks to God for all the joy we feel in the presence of our God because of you?

10.verse: We pray fervently day and night that we will be allowed to see you face to face once again and complete whatever may be lacking in your faith.

11.verse: May our God and Father himself and our Lord Jesus prepare the way to you.

12.verse: May the Lord cause your love to increase and overflow for one another and for everyone else, just as our love does for you.

13.verse: May he so strengthen your hearts in holiness that you may stand blameless before our God and Father at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his holy ones. [Amen.]

1.verse: God Wills Your Sanctification -Chapter 4 -Respect for the Body. -Finally, brethren, you learned from us how you ought to live so that you may be pleasing to God—and as you are indeed doing. Now we ask and exhort you in the Lord Jesus to do so even more.

2.verse: For you know what instructions we gave you by the authority of the Lord Jesus.

3.verse: It is the will of God that you should lead a life of sanctity. You must refrain from sexual immorality.

4.verse: Each of you must learn to acquire a wife from pure and honorable motives,

5.verse: not to gratify passion like the Gentiles who do not know God.

6.verse: No one is ever to wrong or take advantage of a brother in this regard.As we have previously instructed you and solemnly warned you, the Lord is the avenger in all this.

7.verse: For God has called us to holiness, not to impurity.

8.verse: Therefore, anyone who rejects these instructions rejects not human authority but the God who also gives his Holy Spirit to you.

9.verse: An Honorable Life. -In respect to brotherly love, there is no necessity to write to you about that, for you yourselves have been taught by God to love one another.

10.verse: And indeed you have shown your love to all the brethren throughout Macedonia. However, we urge you, brethren, to make even greater progress in this regard.

11.verse: Strive to live quietly, to attend to your own affairs, and to work with your hands, as we instructed you.

12.verse: In this way, you will earn the respect of outsiders and not have to be dependent on anyone.

13.verse: The Dead and the Living at the Lord’s Coming. -We do not wish you to be uncertain, brethren, about those who have fallen asleep. You should not grieve as do those who have no hope.

14.verse: For we believe that Jesus died and rose again, and so too do we believe that God will bring forth with Jesus those who have fallen asleep in him.

15.verse: Indeed, we can assure you, on the word of the Lord himself, that we who are still alive at the coming of the Lord will not have any advantage over those who have fallen asleep.

16.verse: When the command is given, at the sound of the archangel’s voice and the call of God’s trumpet, the Lord himself will descend from heaven, and those who have died in Christ will be the first to rise.

17.verse: Then those of us who are still alive and are left will be caught up together with them on clouds in the air to meet the Lord. And so, we will be with the Lord forever.

18.verse: Therefore, comfort one another with these words.

1.verse: Chapter 5 -The Christian Life Is One Long Vigil. -In regard to specific dates and times, brethren, it is not necessary to write you.

2.verse: For you yourselves are fully aware that the Day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night.

3.verse: When people are saying, “Everything is peaceful and secure,” instant destruction will overwhelm them, in the manner that labor pains suddenly come upon a pregnant woman, and there will be no means of escape.

4.verse: However, brethren, you do not live in darkness, and therefore that Day will not catch you unawares like a thief.

5.verse: For all of you are children of the light and children of the day. We do not belong to the night or to the darkness.

6.verse: So we must not fall asleep as the others do, but we must stay alert and sober.

7.verse: Those who sleep do so at night, and those who get drunk do so at night.

8.verse: But since we belong to the day, let us be sober, arming ourselves with faith and love as our breastplate and the hope of salvation as our helmet.

9.verse: For God has not destined us to suffer wrath, but to achieve salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ.

10.verse: He died for us so that, whether we are awake or asleep, we may live together with him.

11.verse: Therefore, encourage one another and strengthen one another, as indeed you are doing.

12.verse: Building Up the Community -Show Respect for Leaders. -Brethren, we beg you to respect those whose duty it is to labor among you as your leaders in the Lord and to admonish you.

13.verse: Show the highest esteem for them in love because of their work. Be at peace with one another.

14.verse: We also exhort you, brethren, to admonish those who are idle, encourage those who are afraid, support those who are weak, and be patient with everybody.

15.verse: Make sure that no one pays back evil for evil. Rather, always aim to achieve what is best for each other and for everyone.

18.verse: give thanks in all circumstances; for this is the will of God for you in Christ Jesus.

19.verse: Do Not Extinguish the Spirit. -Do not quench the Spirit.

21.verse: Test everything, and hold fast to what is good.

23.verse: Conclusion -Final Prayer. -May the God of peace himself grant you the gift of perfect sanctity, and may you—spirit and soul and body—be preserved blameless for the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

24.verse: The one who calls you is faithful, and he will accomplish this.

26.verse: Greet all the brethren with a holy kiss.

27.verse: I charge you before the Lord to have this letter read to all the brethren.

28.verse: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
